name: Fossacolle Brunello Di Montalcino
description: On the nose it shows alluring aromas of ripe red berries and delicate spices. On the palate the full body is gratifying and persistent, with outstanding minerality. Remarkable tannins, soft and creamy in texture, confer concentration and aging potential to this wine.

name: Four Graces Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
description: The wines are crafted under the guidance of Tim Jones who is thrilled to be able to taste and compare some of the best grapes in Willamette Valley.

name: Four Graces Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
description: The 2018 Pinot Noir showcases a beautiful ruby hue in the glass. Pleasant aromas of raspberry, Bing cherry and hints of earthy forest floor and chanterelle mushrooms mingle. The palate exudes bright red fruit flavors of cherry and cranberry which are complemented by a focused mid palate of black pepper and light roasted coffee beans. The finish has bright flavors with perfectly balanced acidity.

name: Foxglove Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Good California Cabernets in this price range are a rarity, but this wine made Eric Asimov’s recent “Top 20 Reds under $20” article in the New York Times. “Foxglove is the reliable value arm of Varner Wine, which makes fine Chardonnays and Pinot Noirs [and which Joel has visited]. Foxglove expands that range with moderately priced wines like this Paso Robles Cabernet, which is bold and intense yet not at all a fruit bomb. It’s juicy and balanced and will go well with steaks and chops.” Varner Vineyards is the life and love of Jim and Bob Varner. Bob is the winemaker, Jim is the business guy. They grow the grapes for their estate Pinot Noirs and Chardonnays around the winery in Santa Cruz. The grapes for the foxglove wines are purchased. The Cabernet Sauvignon, which is a nearly 11,000-case cuvée, comes from northern Paso Robles from all hillside vineyards and represents a soft, round, juicy, succulent style of Cabernet. It has black and red currants, loamy soil notes and plenty of juiciness. The wine is delicious and best drunk over the next 2-3 years.

name: Foxglove Wine Zinfandel Paso Robles Single
description: Notes of raspberry jam, chocolate and spice. Smooth with velvety tannins, fruity without being cloying.

name: Francis Coppola Diamond Pinot Noir
description: na

name: Francis Coppola Sofia Monterey County Blanc De Blancs
description: Fruity and refreshing, Sofia Blanc de Blancs is a rare blend of Pinot Blanc, Muscat, and Riesling. Mellow flavors of apples and pears are topped by a hint of citrus and honeysuckle. Elegant in character, this wine is lightly textured and vibrant through the finish. This light sparkling wine is a favorite for parties.

name: Francis Ford Coppola Diamond Collection Syrah Green Label

name: Francis Ford Coppola Sofia Rose Monterey
description: Feminine and stylish, with a fragrant perfume of fresh strawberries and lavendar, this rosé explodes with ripe, juicy flavors of cherry, raspberry and citrus zest. This refreshing wine is reminiscent of the popular dry rosés served in seaside café along the French Riviera. It’s crisp, delicate, and elegantly fruity with just a kiss of spice on the finish. We typically harvest the grapes for our Sofia Rosé at a lower brix to ensure we get a light wine that pairs elegantly with food. For color extractions, the grapes are cold-soaked for 48 hours before the juice is separated from the skins.

name: Franciscan Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Deep garnet color. Blackberry and dark cherry with hints of peppercorn, fresh tobacco leaf, dark chocolate, and musk. Rich, full, and textured. Cassis and dark berry with a hint of anise. Dried herbs add to the complexity as the finish lingers with firm, yet finely knit, tannins.

name: Franzia Pinot Grigio
description: Since 1906. The world's most popular wine. Award winning wines. The Story Behind Franzia: A new beginning - Teresa Franzia, my grandmother, planted her first vineyard along the road to Yosemite in 1906. Her family survived Prohibition by selling these grapes to home wine makers back East. When Prohibition ended, my father and his six brothers and sisters rebuilt the winery brick by brick, barrel by barrel - everyone pitched in. After the war, my uncles new advertising slogan, make friends with Franzia, introduced a new generation to wine. Our revolutionary fresh to the last glass Winetap system made its debut in 1978. Because it was more convenient and offered better value than bottles, Franzia started to catch on. It went on to become the world's most popular wine and the first (and only) Winetap to freshness date every package. As we enter our second century of winemaking, we strive to uphold Teresa's legacy of quality, freshness and value. Not just by winning competitions around the world, but more importantly, by helping to bring the enjoyment of good wine to your home each night. The World's most popular wine is also the World's most cost and carbon efficient wine. We are proud of what we are doing and we plan to do more. Significantly Less CO2 Emissions: Franzia WineTaps use significantly smaller energy resources in packaging production and fabrication. Significantly Less Packaging Waste: With 85% less landfill waste than traditional glass, Franzia WineTaps dramatically reduce the environmental burden of excess packaging. Smaller Carbon Footprint: 50% more carbon efficient than 750ml glass bottles. Lighter than heavy glass bottles, Franzia WineTaps require fewer trucks to deliver the same amount of wine resulting in less emissions, less pollution, less cost and less greenhouse gases. Less Wine Waste: This award-winning wine stays fresh to the last glass, even after the package has been opened, because Franzia's patented spout and unique inner pouch prevent the oxidation that occurs in half empty wine-in-bottles. Enjoy for at least 6 weeks after opening. Alc 12% by volume.

name: Freemark Abbey Cabernet Sauvignon
description: There are nuances of dark chocolate, chocolate berry truffle dusted with cocoa powder, cola, aromatic cedar, cinnamon, clove, graham crackers and a hint of tobacco.

name: Freemark Abbey Napa Valley Chardonnay
description: The Napa Valley Chardonnay wine is a rich and complex wine. Aromas of ripe Fuji apple, butterscotch and lemon curd are present on the nose. The barrel fermentation added complex aromas of soft vanilla, angel food cake and baking spices.

name: Frei Brothers Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Frei Brothers Reserve Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon Red Wine is a rich wine with firm, velvety tannins. Notes of blackberry, raspberry and cedar paired with the tannins lead to a long, elegant finish. Highly versatile, this Cabernet Sauvignon wine is great on its own or paired with any meal, and is perfect for a date night. This Frei Brothers wine from California is crafted with grapes from the coveted hillside vineyards in the Alexander Valley, offering unparalleled complexity and flavor. Frei Brothers Reserve crafts high-quality wines that are a true expression of Sonoma County.

name: Frei Brothers Merlot
description: Frei Brothers Merlot is well-balanced and medium bodied with ripe fruit notes and plush tannins. Aromas of red licorice and blackberry meld with hints of toasted oak, milk chocolate and roasted coffee on each sip. Highly versatile, this Merlot wine is great on its own or paired with any meal, and is perfect for a backyard party. This California red wine is crafted with grapes from the sun-drenched vineyards in Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma County. Awarded 90 Points from The Wine Advocate, Frei Brothers Reserve Merlot offers a high-quality wine that is a true expression of Sonoma County.

name: Frei Brothers Sauvignon Blanc
description: Frei Brothers Russian River Valley Sauvignon Blanc is a crisp and refreshing white wine. It features bright acidity and flavors of lemon, lime, melon and freshly cut grass. Subtle hints of vanilla and cream from oak aging balance the crisp palate.

name: Freixenet Cordon Negro Brut
varietal: Macabeu, Xarel Lo, Parellada, Brut, Cava
description: Cordon Negro Brut is a crisp, clean and well-balanced 'cava' sparkling wine. The fresh palate of apple, ripe pear and bright citrus flavors combine with a long finish and an exciting touch of ginger.

name: Frenzy Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
description: Intensely aromatic and lively with flavors of peach, grapefruit, lime, melon and cut grass. This is a crisp, refreshing, vibrant and aromatic example of Marlborough’s best Sauvignon Blanc that can be enjoyed as an aperitif, or match with seafood.

name: Frescobaldi Nipozzano Chianti Rufina Riserva
description: Chianti Rùfina DOCG Riserva Sangiovese 90%, complementary varieties (Malvasia nera, Colorino, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon), Nipozzano Riserva Chianti Rufina DOCG is one of the historic wines produced at the Castello di Nipozzano. This wine always retains its close relationship with the Castello di Nipozzano terroir. Serving suggestions:Barbecued meat and beef stews, aged cheeses. JS 91 Very tight and refined with a linear structure and precision. Medium body, fine tannins and plenty of berry, tea leaf and lemon rind flavors. Pretty and focused. Delicious as always. Drink now.- James Suckling

name: Frey Biodynamic Cabernet Sauvignon
description: No added sulfites. Vibrant, focused and expressive, with flavors of allspice, huckleberry and underbrush, our Cabernet mirrors the terrior of Redwood Valley's complex ecosystem. Graceful tannins sustain a velvety mouthfeel, with subtle violet notes on the finish. Pair with New York steaks and Gorgonzola butter or wild mushroom risotto.

name: Gaja Idda Etna Rosso
description:
Etna is not just a volcano: it is a mountain that originated over hundreds of thousands of years of lava eruptions. The Sicilians attribute a female nature to it: a strict yet generous mother, which is why they call her ‘IDDA,’ meaning ‘SHE’ in the Sicilian dialect. IDDA is pure energy, it is land where every fruit ripens with many different nuances.

IDDA Etna Rosso 2017 is the inaugural vintage from the newly formed alliance between the Gaja and Graci families. A venture founded to explore the southern slope of Mount Etna, with the purpose of searching for vineyards that express elegance and complexity.

This flagship wine layers the citrus and mineral notes of the Loire Valley with the peach and tropical fruit characteristics of Napa Valley. Careful vineyard selection and farming preserve fresh acidity and some of the variety’s grassy characteristics, creating a complex, modern wine with international appeal.

name: Golan Heights Winery Mount Hermon White Galilee
description: Bright melon, citrus, floral, guava and green apple characters. The highest quality area within the appellation is the Golan Heights, the coolest region in Israel.

name: Goose Bay Pinot Noir
description:
Tasting notes: Aromas of raspberry, red cherry, strawberry, and light oak. Strawberry, cherry and other berry flavors on the palate. Good up front and middle palate with a soft finish. Very good length.

Production notes: Grapes were crushed and placed into small One Ton containers allowing the yeast to slowly ferment the wine over a four to five week period. Post ferment soaking is allowed for about two weeks to obtain further extraction.

Special points: Mevushal, Kosher for Passover, Vegan

name: Goose Bay Sauvignon Blanc
description:
Tasting notes: A vibrant, crisp Sauvignon blanc with a bouquet that includes Gooseberries and lush tropical fruit and a palate including ripe Gooseberries, green gage plums, and tropical fruits with a slight hint of oak. 

Production notes: The grapes are crushed and once pressed the juice is allowed to settle for two days. The juice is then flash pasteurised and placed in a tank containing French oak. It is fermented very cool which takes about 4-6 weeks to complete. Racked off its rough lee's it is allowed to age for a further four months.

Special points: Mevushal, Kosher for Passover, vegan

name: Gosset Champagne Brut Excellence
description:
With a clear, bright, pale-yellow gold color, and a nose that reveals yellow fruits such as apricots, peaches and dried fruit, this cuvée is ideally suited to be enjoyed in the summer months.

“A harmonious and pleasant cuvée made to be an apéritif.” Jean-Pierre Mareigner, Cellarmaster

name: Gosset Champagne Grand Brut Rose
description:
The Grand Brut Rosé is a soft hue of salmon pink with a few ruby-cherry reflections. The nose is clearly marked by strawberries. Well-structured with a constant tension between freshness and fruity roundness, the wine is dominated by a red pulpy fruit — perhaps wild strawberry (cream or as a coulis) — giving a soft, coated sensation. It is round with a beautifully fresh finish.

“This is almost a vintage. Indeed, I added just a very little amount of reserve wines. The low dosage gives a nice balance. The red wines from Bouzy and Ambonnay are in perfect balance with the majority of the Chardonnay.” Jean-Pierre Mareigner, Cellarmaster

go anywhere. govino.

name: Graffito Cabernet Franc
description: Jimena believes that good winemaking is simple winemaking. It starts in the vineyard with quality grapes. Beyond this, she believes in 3 key principles to make great wine: know-how, obsession for details, and above all passion.

name: Graham's Six Grapes Reserve Port
description: Six Grapes has a seductive, rich aroma of ripe plums, cherries and dark chocolate notes. On the palate it's complex, with an excellent structure and a long, lingering finish. Six Grapes is one of Graham's original Port blends--it is a very full-bodied, luscious wine drawn from the same vineyards as Graham's Vintage Ports. Blended from two or three years' harvests, the wine is an average of five to six years old when it is lightly filtered and bottled.

name: Graham's Tawny Port 10 Year
description: Graham's 10 Years Old Tawny Port is a tribute to craftsmanship. It epitomizes the passion for excellence and precision that is at the heart of every one of Graham's handmade Tawny Ports. After a decade of care and slow oak-maturation this wine is a wonderful example of the complex flavours of Tawny Port. This is a Port wine for those who appreciate quality in every detail.

name: Grahams Vintage Port
description: Wine Advocate (Parker): 95 "With a big eucalyptus note up front, this is elegant in the mid-palate with controlled tannins. Sweet and easy in some ways, this is readily approachable now, perhaps not at peak, but more expressive than the relatively brooding Dow's, also reviewed. The hint of caramel and raisins mixed with sugar makes this irresistible. It is sexy and intriguing."

name: Grand Finale Mt Brave
description: The Grand Finale idea came to fruition when, after winning one of the Barrel Lots, Gary approached the winemaker to see if they would be willing to add a bit of wine from another of their most favorite barrels to the leftover Barrel Lot and bottle a few cases for us under the “Grand Finale” label. The final products are representative of the finest wine from the winemakers and a taste of what Premier Napa Valley wines are all about.. AND at a mere fraction of the cost!

name: Grand Finale Vineyard 7 & 8
description: The Grand Finale idea came to fruition when, after winning one of the Barrel Lots, Gary approached the winemaker to see if they would be willing to add a bit of wine from another of their most favorite barrels to the leftover Barrel Lot and bottle a few cases for us under the “Grand Finale” label. The final products are representative of the finest wine from the winemakers and a taste of what Premier Napa Valley wines are all about.. AND at a mere fraction of the cost!

name: Grand Puy Lacoste
description: na

name: Grattamacco Bolgheri Superiore
description: Grattamacco’s Bolgheri Rosso Superiore is iconic in Bolgheri, Italy, and beyond. The flagship wine of the estate, this was the second important wine to come from the Bolgheri area following Sassicaia.

name: Grey Wacke Sauvignon Blanc
description:
A musky fusion of sweet scented fruits - nectarines, peaches and nashi pears with a dash of orange zest - intermingled with a floral perfume reminiscent of star jasmine and
citrus blossom. A generous palate with citrus and cassis flavours, deliciously ripe and succulent, finishing with that classic Marlborough zing. Fruit was sourced from various prime vineyard sites in Marlborough’s Southern Valleys and the central Wairau Plains, specifically in Woodbourne, Renwick and Rapaura. Soil types vary from the young alluvial soils of Rapaura and Renwick, which contain high proportions of New Zealand’s ubiquitous greywacke river stones, to the older and denser clay-loams of the Southern Valleys. The majority of the vineyards were trained using the divided Scott Henry canopy management system, with the balance on a two- or three-cane VSP (vertical shoot positioning) trellis. Sauvignon blanc was harvested largely by machine during the cool (often cold) night-time conditions. Fruit was harvested directly into half-tonne bins, which were tipped directly into a tank press. The grapes were pressed relatively lightly and the resulting juice was cold-settled prior to fermentation. The juice was fermented in stainless steel tanks, primarily
using cultured yeast with a cool, slow fermentation. A portion was allowed to undergo spontaneous indigenous yeast fermentation using slightly warmer fermentation regimes.
All individual vineyard batches were left on lees and kept separate until late July, when the blend was assembled.

name: Grgich Hills Cabernet Sauvignon
description: na

name: Grgich Hills Chardonnay
description:
The wine doesn’t undergo malolactic fermentation, preserving its natural acidity. Fermented and aged for ten months in French oak. 

Intense white peach, pear tart and pineapple scents with touches of honeysuckle, struck flint, pie crust and honeycomb. Medium-bodied with fantastic tension and loads of citrus and tropical layers, it has a satiny texture and finishes with great length.

name: Groth Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon shows off a beautiful dark cherry color in the glass with aroma notes of plums, dried cherries, and toasted hazelnuts. The mouthfeel is round and juicy with firm full tannins, rich fruit flavors of huckleberry and a dried cherry sweetness fade into the warm spicy finish with hints of blackberry.

name: Groth Cabernet Sauvignon Rsv Oakville Napa Valley
description: This wine is sourced from a unique block in the heart of the appellation and the producer's 165-acre estate, rich in sedimentary rock fragments of quartz and fossils. It's lush and soft on the palate, with leather, ripe red berry and cassis flavors. The tannins are strong and wrapped tenaciously around the fruit, requiring further time in bottle; drink 2020–2028

name: Grounded By Josh Phelps Sauvignon Blanc
description: Grounded in heritage, grounded in soil, grounded in simplicity. The Grounded by Josh Phelps wines are a testament to Josh's connections with growers throughout his home state.

name: Grounded Wine Co. Landform Pinot Noir
description: Through brilliant medium ruby color, the 2018 Landform Pinot Noir is a wine with a very expressive personality. Leading with compelling aromas of freshly-crushed cherry, strawberry, and raspberry. On the palate, the wine is refreshing, with a structure that is surprisingly full-bodied and seamless from start to finish. There is just enough texture to provide a sense of vibrant energy, which culminates in a lively crescendo highlighted by fresh cherry and strawberry flavors.

name: Grounded Wine Co. Space Age Rose
description:
On the night of July 20, 1969, we stared at the moon and listened to the radio chatter of the Apollo 11 astronauts. One voice boomed back to the listeners on Earth declaring, "That's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind." This brand focuses on the emotions at play during the American Space Age, producing a grounded authenticity that speaks of the wine inside.

After being picked cold in the early morning hours, we follow a rigorous program modeled after the techniques used to produce our favorite southern-France rosés. Whole clusters go directly to into the press upon arrival, and the delicate juice is slowly fermented at ultra-low temperatures en route to early bottling, all in our quest to preserve maximum freshness.

With its classic pale pink “eye of the partridge color,” prized by rosé producers in Provence, the 2018 Space Age Rosé delivers an amazingly fresh, vibrant rush of bright aromas of strawberry, rose petal hibiscus and cranberry. The crisp natural acidity keeps these aromas alive and fresh on the palate and through the surprisingly long, fragrant finish.

Food Pairing:
Pan Seared Sea Bass with Fresh Lemon
Asian Citrus Salad
Herb Roasted Chicken with Thyme and Basil

Cheese Pairing:
Soft, bloomy rind cheese such as Brie or Camembert

name: Gruet Blanc De Noirs
description:
Tasting notes: Mature, with good richness and complexity built around a core of earthy pear, spice and hazelnut flavors. Finishes with a nice dry aftertaste. Pale salmon in color, this full-bodied wine had a fine mousse and a creamy, rich texture. Complex aromas and flavors of raspberry, baked pear and cherry are complemented by a hint of toasted vanilla. The balance of fruit, minerals and crisp acidity lead to a round mouthfeel and lasting finish.

Production notes:  Bottle Aged en Tirage for a minimum of 24 months.

name: Gruet Brut Half Bottle
description: na

name: Gruet Brut Rosé Méthode Champenoise
description: A beautiful garnet in color, this Rosé  has a number of aromatics from simple floral notes to mouth watering strawberry all while maintaining a zesty acidity and delicate finish.

name: Guiberteau Saumur Blanc

name: Guiberteau Saumur Rouge Les Arboises

name: Gundlach Bundschu Mountain Cuvee
description: A Bordeaux-inspired blend for everyday life that’s soft, lush and smooth but never sweet. Dangerously easy-drinking, this Merlot and Cabernet-based red wine offers balance, food-friendly structure and approachability.

name: Gustav Gruner Veltliner
description: na

name: H Blin Champagne Brut
description:
Golden straw, sparkling clear and transparent. Abundance of fine, light but persistent bubbles. On the nose, lively and expressive. Scents of dried flowers still with traces of their original freshness develop into faded overtones of straw and forest floor. When the wine has breathed slightly, a discreet dash of vanilla coupled with nuances of fresh butter and freshly baked bread. Flavors are supple, honest and powerful. The wine seems to launch into lively aromas that are lightness itself, perfectly orchestrated scents of cooked fruits admirably sharpened by a dash of eau-de-vie, preserve figs and quince jelly. Sparkling with fine fresh bubbles, the wine grows rounder as it develops, offering heady notes of exotic fruits (mango, lychees and passion fruit).
Pair with a white meat (veal, poultry) in a creamy sauce or a sweet-sour meal (duck with pears or peaches) are ideal partners of this lively champagne.
Blend: 80% Pinot Meunier, 20% Chardonnay

name: Hahn Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Inviting blackberry and cassis aromatics complement notes of vanilla, toasted oak and a touch of leather. Rich and robust, chewy tannins frame flavors of blackberry and blueberry leading to a smooth, opulent finish.

name: Hahn Chardonnay
description: na

name: Hahn Pinot Noir
description:
Tasting notes: Aromas include red cherry, ripe strawberry, cola and spice. Flavors of plum and black cherry are completed by a soft mouthfeel. Supple tannins and a bit of acidity end in a beautifully balanced and clean finish.

Production notes: Arroyo Seco appellation of Monterey County, which sits on a gravelly alluvial plain beneath the Santa Lucia mountain range. Cool winds from Monterey Bay ensure gradual ripening and development of vibrant flavors. The rocky soils allow excellent drainage, enhancing intensity and promoting balanced ripeness and acidity.Aged in French oak (40% new, 60% neutral).

name: Hahn SLH Chardonnay
description: Vibrant and rich-tasting, offering a complex array of fig, quince, pear and ripe citrus flavors. Well-structured, with notes of lemon meringue on the plush, focused finish. Drink now through 2022. SMART BUY

name: Hahn Winery Merlot
description: This Merlot displays aromas of ripe plum, rich cocoa, blueberry, and violet with hints of juicy black cherry.

name: Harper Voit Strandline Pinot Noir
description: The diversity of soil types, microclimates, and clonal selections in the Willamette Valley continues to drive Voits vineyard and winery work. This wine is an expression of that diversity, a synthesis of vineyards from which they craft single-vineyard wines. The 2016 Strandline Pinot Noir is immediately expressive with a fruit profile reflective of the warmer vintage. The integrated grape and oak tannins create a supple, titillating texture on the palate, while the finish is focused by refreshing acidity.

name: Hartford Court Chardonnay Four Hearts Vineyards
description: Spiced orchard fruits, candle wax, hazelnut, and some crushed rock that gives way to a medium to full-bodied, rich, beautifully textured, layered, and long Chardonnay.

name: Harveys Bristol Cream Sherry
description: Launched in 1882, and granted the Royal Warrant shortly after, Bristol Cream is crafted from a delicate blend of Jerez’s finest wines; delicate finos, aged amontillados, fragrant olorosos and the special Pedro Ximenez grape providing a silky, mellow smoothness. Known for its deep golden chestnutty and amber tones, the nose is full, fragrant, pungent and elegant all at once. On the palate Bristol Cream delivers a full bodied experience with rich yet mellow notes leaving a long lasting and velvety finish. A complete, balanced and surprising compendium of wine from Jerez, it’s best enjoyed chilled at 12°C in a wine glass or mix over ice with a slice of orange.

name: Henri Boillot Clos De Vougeot Grand Cru
description: he 2018 Clos Vougeot Grand Cru is showing very well, soaring from the glass with aromas of wild berries, rose petals, violets, orange rind and dark chocolate. On the palate, it's full-bodied, concentrated and muscular, with lively acids and a powdery but elegantly refined chassis of structuring tannins, concluding with a long and resonant finish-Wine Advocate

name: Henri Boillot Corton Charlemagne Grand Cru
description: The most youthfully reserved wine in the cellar was the 2018 Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru, a promising bottling that opens up to reveal scents of citrus zest, dried white flowers, green apple and pastry cream. On the palate, the wine is full-bodied, layered and multidimensional, with racy acids and prodigious levels of searingly chalky dry extract that lend this wine incredible structure-Wine Advocate

name: Hess Select Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Winemaker David Guffy crafted the Hess Select Cabernet Sauvignon with notable richness, intensity and varietal character, showing jammy dark fruit aromas with cedary barrel notes and a touch of spice. A soft entry, with ripe plum and raspberry in the forefront, is supported by background flavors of tobacco and caramel, which add complexity to this imminently drinkable wine.

name: Hess Select Chardonnay
description: Monterey's cooling fog and Pacific coastal breezes, drawn across the Gabilan Mountains into the Salinas Valley, create an ideal climate for growing Chardonnay, yielding wines with tantalizing tropical notes and crisp acidity. Moderate temperatures lengthen the growing season, allowing fruit to evolve with layers of distinct Central Coast flavors. This wine comes from our 352-acre Shirtail Creek estate vineyard in Monterey.

name: Hewitson Gun Metal Riesling
description: na

name: Hewitson Lu Lu Shiraz
description: With vineyards superbly situated close to the coast just east of the city of Adelaide, winemaker Dean Hewitson is able to bring cool climate elegance to Australia’s most venerable varietal.  Sublime with succulent cherries, forest floor fruits, pepper, spice, a hint of minty eucalyptus (of course!), and awesome tannins, Lu Lu leaves a lingering finish that truly satisfies.  Sip this with hearty stews, red meats, burgers, and just about anything from the barbie!

description: The San Andreas Fault is Hirsch Vineyards’ signature Pinot Noir and is crafted to represent the entirety of this multifaceted vineyard. The 2017 San Andreas Fault has fruit from twenty eight distinct farming blocks.

name: Hourglass Blueline Vineyard Merlot
description: Deep and rich, yet alive with energy. A very complex layering of delicious fruit, wired with bright natural acidity and vibrant minerality. The finish is long and expansive. Amazingly approachable now, but it has the tannin and structural stuffing to age gracefully for a decade, or more.

name: Hourglass H G I I I
description:
HG III is Tony Biagi’s riff on the Napa Valley red blend. Crafted with select lots from their Blueline Estate and carefully sourced vineyards in Napa Valley, HG III embodies the deft balance of richness and vibrancy that is at the heart of what they do at Hourglass.
Merlot offers sleek, approachable texture and bright red fruit components, Petite Sirah provides the anchoring bass notes of dark blue and black fruit, and Cabernet weaves these together with structural framing and elegant refinement.

name: Hourglass Sauvignon Blanc
description: Primary aromas of lemon and lime zest, orange blossom, Granny Smith apple and faint tropical notes are followed on the palate with a layered blend of limeade, cut hay, nectarine, pineapple, and vanilla bean.

name: Huet Vouvray Clos Du Bourg Sec
description: Gaston Huët believed this to be the greatest of all Vouvray vineyards. With the Première Côte’s shallowest, stoniest soils, its wines often synthesize Le Mont’s intense minerality with Le Haut-Lieu’s generous texture. Clos du Bourg is often the richest and most powerful wine in the lineup.

name: Huet Vouvray Haut Lieu Sec
description: The estate’s first vineyard, purchased in 1928. Its nine hectares have the richest soils and, generally, yields the most precocious wines.

name: Huet Vouvray Le Mont Demi Sec
description: Purchased in 1957, Le Mont lies on the esteemed Premiere Côte. With less clay and more stone than Le Haut-Lieu, Le Mont yields young wines of intense minerality.

name: Hyde De Villaine Chardonnay
description: How could this wine be anything but stunning, seeing that it is a partnership between Larry Hyde and Aubert de Villaine of Domaine de la Romanee-Conti? Suckling flipped for its "freshness and powerful acidity that gives it intensity and focus. Goes on and on with so much floral and sliced-lime flavor and hints of white flowers, pear blossom and minerals. So beautiful to drink now."  This has a purity and focus that will appeal to many white Burgundy lovers. With good Chassagne-Montrachet over $100 these days, this wine is a fine bargain.

name: Indaba Merlot
description:
Crafted in a fresh, clean style, this velvety Merlot offers enticing aromas and bright, juicy flavors of cherry, dark berry and plum backed by subtle
mocha and herbal nuances and a delicate minerality.

name: Indaba Sauvignon Blanc
description: A crowd pleaser, this easy drinking Sauvignon Blanc displays appealing citrus and tropical fruit aromas that lead to a fresh, invigorating palate of pineapple, lemon-lime, mango and green fig. Backed by a solid acidity, herbal undertones shine through on the mineral-tinged finish.

name: Inglenook Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
description: Cassis, blackberries, plums, and black currants provide juicy, mouth filling flavors while distinct notes of cigar box, oak, graphite, and earthy spices create aromatic accents.

name: Inniskillin Niagara Icewine VQA Cabernet Franc
description: Inniskillin Icewine, recognized as one of the world’s great wines, is truly winter’s gift to wine lovers. Harvested at the pinnacle of Canada’s crisp winter, the grapes are naturally frozen on the vine and picked when the temperature drops to -10 degrees C. Only a few drops of luscious nectar can be squeezed from each bunch, which is then expertly guided through fermentation to achieve this rich and alluring specialty wine. This Niagara River appellation wine opens with characteristics of strawberry, raspberry and rhubarb dominate the nose while the palate shows a robust concentration of red fruits as well, all of which complemented by a well-balanced acidity. Pairs well with salted dark chocolate, chocolate mousse with fresh berries, strawberry rhubarb pie and porcini dusted rib eye. Serve chilled.

name: Inniskillin Niagara Icewine VQA Riesling
description: Inniskillin Icewine, recognized as one of the world’s great wines, is truly winter’s gift to wine lovers. Harvested at the pinnacle of Canada’s crisp winter, the grapes are naturally frozen on the vine and picked when the temperature drops to -10 degrees C. Only a few drops of luscious nectar can be squeezed from each bunch, which is then expertly guided through fermentation to achieve this rich and alluring specialty wine. This Niagara River appellation wine opens with aromatics of fresh orange, spice, lemon and lime. On the palate this rich and elegant wine shows great texture with concentrated flavors of peach, apricot along with a hint of clove, balanced by a crisp and lively acidity. Pairs well with brie with lavender honey, firm aged cheddar, seared scallops or classic baked apples. Serve chilled.

name: Intrinsic Cabernet Sauvignon
description:
Made using a unique process wherein 50% of the grapes stayed on the skins for nine months, this was aged in neutral French oak. It offers fresh black currant, dried tobacco, herb and green and black olive aromas. The palate is full of light olive and orange peel flavors. Though not immediately identifiable as Cabernet Sauvignon, it's enjoyable all the same.

Drinking window: 2020-2032

name: Ippolito Ciro Bianco
description: Bright straw yellow with pale green notes. Shows with an intense, persistent aroma of ripe tropical fruit, pear, peach and white flowers. The palate is fresh and Mediterranean with a charming mineral finish.

name: Ippolito Liber Pater Ciro Rosso Classico
description: Ruby red in color with a light purple hue, complex aromas of wild berries, violets, spice and a soft note of oak provided by barrique aging. It is a full-bodied, rich and velvety wine.

description: A classic and very expressive Pinot Grigio, bright straw yellow in color with an attractive aroma of citrus fruits, peach, honeydew melon and especially pear; medium rich, fruity, well-structured and direct on the palate with orchard fruit flavors and tangy, fruity acidity on the finish.

name: J Lohr Merlot
description: The wine presents ripe fruit aromas of black cherry and pomegranate. A signature of chocolate and coconut are from the barrel aging. Finishing with bright fruit tones and soft tannin.

name: J M Boillot Montagny Premier Cru
description: Very forest floor and resined on the nose. A bit of vanilla bean and spearmint, nice perfume, and quite elegant for the appellation.

name: J Vineyards California Cuvee Brut
description: J Vineyards & Winery California Cuvée Sparkling Wine opens with a pop of tart pineapple and orange blossom on the wonderfully aromatic nose. The palate is lively and rich with layered notes of Asian pear and honeysuckle, overlaying hints of fresh mandarin orange peel and marzipan before a zesty, focused finish. J California Cuvée experienced secondary fermentation in the bottle and aged on the yeast for a minimum of 24 months, which is customary in the Traditional Method used in Champagne. J Vineyards & Winery, located in Healdsburg, California, is known as a pioneer of US Traditional Method sparkling wine.

name: J Vineyards Pinot Gris
description: J California Pinot Gris is a crisp white wine with refreshing aromas of candied pineapple, lemongrass, white peach and jasmine. Layered with ripe notes of Anjou pear, yellow apple and lime. Crisp acidity and fruit-forward character make this Pinot Gris wine a great pairing for any dish. Made from the same grapes as a Pinot Grigio, J California Pinot Gris offers a fuller body and richer texture than a typical Pinot Grigio. J California Pinot Gris has a screw top that makes this crisp white wine easier to open and enjoy in any setting and occasion. J Vineyards & Winery, located in Healdsburg California, is the home to extraordinary Russian River Valley sparkling and still wines.

name: J Vineyards Pinot Noir Multi AVA
description: J Vineyards California Multi-Appellated Pinot Noir wine is a soft red wine that opens with aromatic notes of black cherry, blackberry and baking spice. The silky palate features notes of cranberry and fig with hints of black tea and clove. This California Pinot Noir wine is crafted with grapes from Monterey County, Sonoma County, Santa Barbara County winegrowing regions. Enjoy this Pinot Noir wine on its own or pair it with a meal. J Vineyards & Winery, located in Healdsburg California, is home to extraordinary Russian River Valley sparkling and still wines.

name: Jackson-Triggs Reserve Niagara Peninsula Vidal Ice Wine
description: Jackson-Triggs Niagara Icewine Vidal exhibits aromatic intensity of fruit and caramel. On the palate, papaya, apricot and mango for a luscious finish. Nectar-like in both flavor and texture, this Ice Wine boasts delectable notes of honey and vanilla, which are perfectly complemented by bight green apple and citrus zest. The lush and creamy mouthfeel is perfectly supported by a vibrant, fresh acidity, while flavors of lemon candy linger on the finish.

name: Jadot Chambolle Musigny Les Charmes
description: This deeply colored wine develops intense red fruit, spice and earthy aromas and flavors. It is elegant and beautifully balanced, and will improve for 15 to 20 years in the bottle.

name: Jadot Puligny Montrachet Clos de la Garenne Domaine Duc de Magenta
description: Puligny-Montrachet is located to the south of Meursault and to the north of Chassagne-Montrachet, at the heart of the greatest white vineyards of Burgundy. The Clos de la Garenne is located next to Les Folatières, on a stony soil close to the mother rock.

name: Jam Jar Sweet Shiraz
description: A more fun style than your typical Shiraz, this fresh, fruity, semi-sweet wine displays aromas and flavors of ripe, juicy berries with dark chocolate undertones. The perfect balance between sweetness and acidity makes for a refreshing approachability. It is versatile food wine, best served lightly chilled.

name: Jean Louis Chave Cotes du Rhone Mon Coeur
description: In Chave's "Mon Coeur" (My heart) the blend changes from year to year, but is normally about 50-50 Grenache and Syrah. I would classify this as a more "Northern Rhône style Côtes du Rhône. Syrah in this wine is much more present as it boasts more black fruit, herbs, and an olive note that can't be mistaken.  This note normally comes off strongly in Northern Rhone Syrah, but is very prevalent here.  The nose translates strongly to the palate on this, however, the Grenache adds an added level of complexity and roundness, to bring you back down to the Southern Rhône.

name: Jean Luc Colombo Cape Bleue Rose
description:
Soft, delicate pink. Subtle hints of peach, rose petal and pepper on the nose. Dry and complex, with intriguing notes of raspberries, fresh cherry, black olive, and fennel.

A great Rose to enjoy on its own or with a wide range of appetizers, fish, poultry dishes and vegetarian fare.

name: Jean Paul Brun Beaujolais Blanc Terres Dorees
description: Bottled without any oak, this is rich and full with a terrific mineral finish. With a fresh and fruity bouquet when young, this wine becomes more honeyed as the wine matures, but is always lip-smacking and delicious. This wine exceeds its category.

description: na

name: Jean Paul Brun Terres Dorees l'Ancien
description: Made from Jean-Paul's oldest vines, which grow in tighter bunches with fewer and smaller, thicker-skinned berries, yielding more concentrated flavor. The grapes are harvested late with a naturally high sugar level. The wine is vinified using traditional Burgundy techniques. Deeply colored with rich red-fruit aroma and flavor and soft tannins.

name: Jean-Louis Chave Crozes Hermitage Silène
description: Ripe fruit balanced out by backbone and structure, this Syrah shows plum, black pepper, pencil lead, and warming spices. Perfect with heartier comfort foods such as cassoulet or braised beef short ribs.

name: Jean-Marc Brocard Chablis "Sainte Claire"
description: Wafting from the glass with aromas of lemon oil, wheat toast and dried white flowers, this Chablis is medium-bodied, glossy and textural, with more concentration, depth and tension.

name: Jermann Pinot Grigio
description: Pinot Grigio from Pinot Grigio grapes, fermented as a white wine. It has an intense straw-yellow colour; its aroma is intense, full and fruity, with excellent persistence. Its taste is dry, velvety, and particularly well-orchestrated for its full body. To be paired with fish soups, chargrilled seafood and various dishes based on field mushrooms and porcini mushrooms. This wine is wonderful with squid ink lasagnette pasta and crayfish sauce.

name: Jermann Vintage Tunina White
description: Vintage Tunina is a field blend made of Sauvignon, Chardonnay, Ribolla gialla, Malvasia and little percentage of a sweet local grape variety. It is bright straw-colored with golden reflections. The nose is intense, wide, very elegant and persistent with scents of honey and country flowers. To the palate it is dry, soft, well balanced with an extraordinary persistence due to its full body.

name: Jets Uncorked Reserve Red Wine
description: na

name: Joel Gott Chardonnay
description: Tropical aromas of melon and pineapple that lead to bright citrus flavors and hints of vanilla. On the palate are hints of apple balanced by a clean acidic backbone with a round mid palate and minerally finish.

name: Joel Gott Pinot Noir Santa Barbara
description: Joel Gott Santa Barbara Pinot Noir has aromas of raspberries, black cherries, plum and baking spices. On the palate, the wine opens with flavors of bright berry compote.

name: Joel Gott Sauvignon Blanc
description: The Joel Gott California Sauvignon Blanc has bright citrus aromas complemented by tropical notes. Refreshing flavors of melon lead to juicy Meyer lemon zest flavors on the mid palate, and a long, clean, and balanced finish.

name: Joh Jos Prum Wehlener Sonnenuhr Kabinett
description: na

name: Joh. Jos. Prüm Riesling Wehlener Sonnenuhr Auslese
description: na

name: John Duval Wines Plexus
description: My aim with Plexus is to express the wide spectrum of red fruit flavours from Shiraz, Grenache and Mourvèdre and also provide structure with a seamless balance and long finish. Traditional, low intervention winemaking techniques are employed allowing the wine to be approachable in its youth, but also cellar for 8-10 years.

name: Joseph Carr Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles
description: Aromas of black cherry, chocolate and vanilla. Flavors of blackberry and sweet spice are bolstered by firm acidity, velvety tannins and a long finish.

name: Joseph Carr Chardonnay
description: na

name: Joseph Drouhin Cote De Beaune Village
description: na

name: Joseph Mellot Sancerre le Montarlet
description: Juicy, lemony mid palate with a zippy, bright, minerally finish...Incredible value!

name: Joseph Phelps Insignia Cabernet Sauvignon
varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc
description:
98 Points - #28 Top 100 Wines of the USA 2019 - James Suckling
Lovely density and intensity with dark berries, blueberries and inky undertones with hints of spice, chocolate and walnuts. Medium to full body, fine tannins and a flavorful finish. The texture and length are fantastic here. Complex. Hints of smoky wood at the end. This needs three to five years more in bottle age. Exciting wine. (May 2019)

name: Joseph Phelps Insignia Presell
description: The rarest offering of Insignia in twenty years, 2017 Insignia opens in the glass with heady aromas of mocha, cedar, roasted espresso, blueberry and ripe plum. Fresh and focused with building layers of black cherry, blackberry preserve, spice box and vanilla essence. Plush, velvety texture and seamless tannins culminate in a lengthy, lingering finish.

name: Joseph Phelps Swan Pinot Noir Lot
description: na

name: Josh Cellars Pinot Noir
description: Our elegantly balanced Pinot Noir has lush cherry and strawberry flavors with a hint of lightly toasted oak. “Dad was a big guy with a gentle manner like our Pinot Noir, which has big fruit flavor but an elegant finish."

name: Julien Sunier Regnie Beaujolais
description: na

name: Justin Girardin Bourgogne Blanc
description: na

name: Justin Isosceles
description: Justin Isosceles is Justin's flagship wine, a full-bodied, luscious ode to Bordeaux varietals grown on California's Central Coast.

name: Justin Justification
description: Cassis, plum, ripe blackberry and spicy vanilla oak anchored by tobacco, espresso and earth. Smooth and velvety on the palate. Full bodied and juicy. Big, bold, but balanced. Delish.

name: Justin Sauvignon Blanc
description:
Our Sauvignon Blanc reflects the diversity of the climates and soils within the Paso
Robles AVA that range from the cool, limestone laden Templeton Gap area to the
warmer, more river sand influenced eastern vineyards. We source from vineyards
in these unique areas to give our Sauvignon Blanc a full palate of tropical and citrus
fruits balanced by a crisp, refreshing mineral structure. The result is a wine that is
both a refreshing summer aperitif, and a perfect pairing for a wide range of cheeses
or seafood dishes.

name: K W V Classic Collection Sauvignon Blanc
description: na

name: K W V Roodeberg Cabernet Shiraz
description: na

name: Kaiken By Montes Malbec Reserva Mendoza
description: Kaiken Estate Malbec shows an intense violet red color revealing the youth of wine. On the nose, the wine has aromas of red fruits such as plum and blackberry, which are complemented by notes of chocolate and tobacco. The palate reveals extraordinary freshness and tannic softness.

name: Kaiken Ultra Malbec
description: na

name: Kanonkop Pinotage
description: na

name: Karen MacNeil Tasting 3pk
description: Join three of the top vintners from Paso Robles, California, for an exclusive live virtual tasting hosted by award-winning author of The Wine Bible, Karen MacNeil on Friday, October 9th at 4:00pm PST. Featured wines will include Tablas Creek’s  2017 Esprit de Tablas, J. Lohr Vineyards & Wines 2018 J. Lohr Estates Seven Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon, and JUSTIN Vineyards & Winery’s 2016 JUSTIFICATION. Get to know and hear from the winemakers who crafted these delicious wines, and see what makes Paso Robles wines so special. Register for the virtual tasting webinar here: https://bit.ly/3j1ranp

name: Kedem Concord Grape
description: na

name: Kedem Malaga
description: na

name: Kedem Malaga Wine
description: na

name: Ken Forrester Petit Pinotage
description:
Crystal dark red with violet tinge in the glass. Nose is cherry and plum with some earthy and smoke. Similar mouth. I can add blackberry, dark chocolate, pepper and oak. Bold, tannic and dry. Perfect with beef.

Young and fresh - strawberries and cherries, with some earthy notes. Easy drinking for easy evening.

name: Ken Wright Cellars Pinot Noir Shea Vineyard
description:
The Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir is floral and spice focused. The wine has a seamless palate weight with red and blue fruits, including anise, cola, raspberry, and black cherry.
Ken Wright Cellars is devoted to showcasing the inherent quality of selected vineyard sites. With clarity and breadth that is unequaled by other varieties, we believe Pinot noir best expresses the character of these sites. Rather than stamping wine with a varietal trademark, Pinot noir is the ultimate vehicle for conveying the aroma, flavor, and texture of the location in which it is grown. Ken Wright Cellars produces a single vineyard Pinot Noir from 13 different vineyard sites in the Northern Willamette Valley.

name: Kendall Jackson Avant Chardonnay
description: Fresh. Crisp. Clean. 100% Jackson Estates grown. Hand selected from our vineyard estates. Kendall-Jackson Avant Chardonnay offers a bright, modern style that delivers a crisp, refreshing expression of this exceptional grape. We crafted this wine in a deliciously lean style, capturing the purity and elegance of the fruit harvested from our Jackson Estates grown vineyards. Vibrant, bright fruit flavors abound - citrus, green apple and fresh pear. Enjoy. Alc. 13.5% by vol.

name: Kendall Jackson Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
description: This Grand Reserve Sonoma County Cabernet showcases flavors of blackberry, blueberry, and both red and black currants with enticing fragrances of mocha and nutmeg. Subtle notes of chocolate and toasty vanilla add to the richness and length of this bold Cab, and are accompanied by fine grained tannins on a lengthy finish.

name: Kendall Jackson Vintner's Reserve Chardonnay Half Bottle
description: Beautifully integrated tropical flavors such as pineapple, mango and papaya, with citrus notes that explode in your mouth.

name: Kendall Jackson Vintner's Reserve Pinot Gris
description:
The Vintner's Reserve Pinot Gris wine is blended with a touch of the Rhône varietals – Roussanne, Viognier, along with Muscat, Albariño and a kiss of other floral varieties, which contribute layers of richness as well as a subtle floral note.

COMPOSITION
76% Pinot Gris, 8% Viognier, 5% Muscat, 4% Roussanne, 3% Pinot Blanc, 2% Albariño, 2% Riesling and other

name: Kendall Jackson Vintner's Reserve Pinot Noir
description: Bright cherry, strawberry and raspberry fruit with elegant earthy notes infused with cola and mild spice accents. Oak aging adds a hint of vanilla and a soft, toasty finish.

name: Kendall Jackson Vintner's Reserve Riesling
description: Deliciously crisp with vibrant fruit aromas and subtle spice notes. Layers of apricot, peach and Anjou pear intermingle with bursts of aromatic jasmine delivering a delightful finish.

name: Kenwood Sonoma County Sauvignon Blanc
description:
One of California’s premium wine pioneers, Kenwood Vineyards is in the heart of Sonoma County. We craft wines with unique varietal character driven from Sonoma’s diverse terroir. Our small-lot winemaking philosophy reflects our dedication to the details, ensuring our wines capture the best Sonoma has to offer.

The selected vineyards for our Sauvignon Blanc are located in the cooler appellations of Carneros and the Russian River Valley, giving the wine a crisp style with citrus characteristics while grapes from the warmer Sonoma Valley impact the melon and tropical fruit flavors of this well-balanced wine.

name: Kermit Lynch Coutale Clos La Cahors
description: Over the years, Philippe has tinkered with the house blend to achieve a greater equilibrium. Today, the blend consists of 80% Malbec and 20% Merlot, creating an intense wine that juggles elegant rusticity with everyday drinkability.

name: Kerner Abbazia Di Novacella Alto Adige
description: Intense yellow stone fruit, grapefruit, smoky flint and nutmeg aromas jump out of the glass. The bright, generous palate doles out juicy apricot, mature peach and orange zest notes, framed by tangy acidity. A mineral note lifts the lingering finish.

name: Kilikanoon The Lackey
description: na

name: Kim Crawford Chardonnay
description: Kim Crawford Chardonnay White Wine is an approachable and full-bodied white wine that shows great length and persistence. It has a medium weight with aromas of ripe tropical fruit, including pineapple and ripe melon. This chardonnay wine offers a creamy texture and hints of butterscotch, lemon meringue pie, ripe stone fruit and citrus. Kim Crawford Chardonnay contains grapes grown in selected vineyards in Marlborough and Hawke’s Bay on the East Coast of New Zealand. Exposed to plenty of sunlight and carefully selected, these grapes create an approachable, fruit-forward chardonnay wine. Secondary malolactic fermentation during the winemaking process gives nuttiness and generous mouthfeel. Serve this bottle of wine with a tasty salmon dish or other white meat favorites. This delicious table white wine is also an ideal choice for your next wine and cheese party. Serve chilled for optimal taste. Making it Amazing with Kim Crawford wine. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2020 Constellation Imports, Rutherford, CA.

name: Kim Crawford Pinot Noir
description: Kim Crawford Pinot Noir Red Wine reflects the care that went into its creation. The high quality grapes used in this pinot noir wine are harvested in the cool night or early morning New Zealand air, producing a pinot noir with ripe, dark berry flavors of blackberry and black currant. Each glass of this red wine permeates aromas of red berry with dark cherry notes, complemented by savory undertones and spicy oak. This Kim Crawford wine starts on New Zealand's South Island, where it begins to develop the bold flavors that make it a great table-side companion for rack of lamb or mushroom risotto. This dark red wine has a full-bodied taste that helps bring a silky, satisfying finish to your meal. To keep this pinot noir wine tasting its best, store it at room temperature and chill for 30 to 60 minutes before serving. For a true taste of New Zealand, Make it Amazing with Kim Crawford Wine. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2020 Constellation Imports, Rutherford, CA USA.

name: King Estate Pinot Gris

name: Kings Ridge Pinot Gris

name: Kings Ridge Pinot Noir
description: This flagship Pinot is hard to beat. A combination of rich red fruit flavors with freshness and vibrancy unique to Pinot Noir grapes grown in our beloved Willamette Valley, this wine truly reflects the character of this region. We think the best vintage is pretty much right now, so start sharing with some with your favorite people. Notes of cherry, pomegranate, and spice.

name: Klinker Brick Farrah Syrah
description: is single vineyard wine has a deep, rich garnet color and shows tobacco, mint and cherries on the nose. With dense silky layers of raspberry and chocolate, this fullbodied wine finishes with hints of earth and spice with a long, smooth finish.

name: Klinker Brick Old Ghost Old Vine Zinfandel

name: Kono Sauvignon Blanc
description: With the abundant sunshine, cool nights and a long growing season in this region, this wine is vibrant with intense citrus and gooseberry flavours and notes of capsicum and passionfruit.A blend of fruits from the Awatere, Waihopai, and Lower Wairau Valleys gives this Sauvignon Blanc the classic Marlborough fruit burst with great palate weight and a clean, acid finish.

name: Korbel Brut
description: America’s favorite California champagne, Korbel Brut is refined, with a balanced, medium-dry finish. Enjoy lively aromas and flavors of apple, pear, and white peaches. The finish is a medium-dry, with a slight savory note at the end, the kind of champagne that calls for celebration.

name: Kosta Browne Russian River Valley Pinot Noir
description: We work with vineyards that span a diverse and varied view into a region that many would call the heartland of California Pinot Noir. Our goal is to create a wine that showcases the essence of this magical appellation. A totally complete Pinot Noir with a recognizably full mouthfeel and texture.

name: Kosta Browne Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir
description: For this wine, we find ourselves drawn to vineyards that are particularly influenced by the Pacific Ocean and are fortunate to work with some spectacular sites. Together, they form a singular wine that is distinctively Sonoma Coast. This Pinot Noir has excellent development of tannins and dark, rich fruit profiles with great depth and a long finish.

name: Kosta Browne Sta Rita Hills Pinot Noir
description: What makes the Sta. Rita Hills truly unique is the purely East/West maritime mouth that funnels cooling coastal fog, and wind to the vines. One of the smaller AVAs in California, Sta. Rita Hills is one of the world’s best cool-climate growing regions of Pinot Noir. This wine is focused, with bright strawberry and cherry notes and a subtle, pleasing tension.

name: Kourtaki Mavrodaphne Of Patras Sweet Red
description: na

name: Kourtaki Retsina
description: na

name: Kris Pinot Grigio
description: With roots in Burgundy, the Pinot Grigio grape has arguably found its home of choice in Northeast Italy. The small, pinkish-gray-skinned grape flourishes in delicate sunshine of this sub-Alpine region. Pinot Grigio has reached unparalleled quality here and surprises the palette with unique floral and spicy notes rarely found in other areas. KRIS handcrafted Pinot Grigio features a flavor profile as playful and expressive as its label suggests.

name: Krug Champagne Grande Cuvee 168th Edition
description: Krug Grande Cuvée is born from the dream of one man, Joseph Krug, to craft the very best Champagne he could offer, every single year, regardless of annual variations in climate. Since 1843, the House of Krug has honoured this vision with each new Édition of Krug Grande Cuvée: the most generous expression of Champagne.

varietal: Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot, Malbec
description:
L’Ecole No 41 is recognized as one of Washington State’s top producers of premium Merlot and this wine delivers with great structure, color and balanced acidity.

TASTING NOTES
Layered with enticing aromas of black cherry, rose petal, and plum, this full bodied yet balanced Merlot shows layers of baking spices and cocoa with a seamless finish of fine-grained tannin.

description: This overachiever brings tremendous complexity and depth for the price! Citrus and orchard fruits blend with honey and a touch of salinity. The palate is on the fuller side owing to several months of lees aging which adds a creamy texture that is balanced by bright acidity and it all comes together elegantly.

name: La Crema Monterey Rose Of Pinot Noir
description: A fruity, crisp, and classic Pinot Noir Rose from the cool climate of Monterey, California. Aromas of Mandarin, pink grapefruit and guava. Flavors of watermelon, strawberry and blood orange are complimented by undertones of minerality.  Delicate, crisp and vibrant.

name: La Crema Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
description: The nose is teeming with baking spices and pie crust. On the palate dense red fruit flavors give way to subtle blue fruit and blood orange notes. Fine tannins knit the wine together.

name: La Crema Russian River Pinot Noir
description: na

name: La Crema Sonoma Coast Chardonnay Half Bottle
description: A round, light, and balanced Chardonnay from California's cool Sonoma Coast. Apricot, lemon, Gala apple, subtle oak and spice aromas. Lemon drop, white stone-fruit yellow plum and honeydew melon on the palate. Richly textured and concentrated with balanced acidity that drives a lingering finish.

name: La Crema Sonoma County Sauvignon Blanc

name: La Gravette De Certan
description: On the palate, the wine has good balance and a round and generous texture. This wine can be enjoyed young with its primary, fruity character and served slightly chilled. A very pretty Pomerol worthy of a great estate.

name: La Jota Keyes Chardonnay
description: The 2017 vintage started with a wet winter followed by a somewhat dry spring and early summer. With plenty of water and nutrients in the soils, the vines responded beautifully during the ripening period. In early September, a heat spell temporarily stalled the vine’s ability to ripen, but as temperatures dropped the vines recovered and ultimately achieved optimal ripeness, leading to a glorious harvest.

name: La Kiuva Arnad Montjovet Vallee D'aosta
description:
Produced by a tiny co-op of 60 growers: only 8,000 cases. On the palate, light red fruit and delicate spice with tannins that provide a long finish with a hint of pleasant bitterness. A little wild and rustic with garrigue, cherry, and bush berries. Excellent acidity  make this a great wine to pair with food.
FOOD PAIRINGS: Mushroom soup, cold cuts and the typical lardo of Arnad

name: La Linda Torrontes
description: na

name: La Luca Prosecco
description: The wine pours an almost translucent bright yellow, with hints of green reflecting off the glass. The nose is instantly defined and distinctive, offering up bold orchard fruits, crisp pears, and lemon curd, all of which come together in a rich, creamy off-dry style that is extremely appealing. There is a deft touch of minerality, playing nicely against the subtle sweetness of the wine. The finish shows excellent length and fine overall balance.

name: La Marca Prosecco
description:
La Marca Prosecco Sparkling Wine is crisp and refreshing with a golden straw color and lively bubbles. This luxurious Prosecco wine features aromas of fresh citrus, honey and white flowers, with fresh, clean flavors of ripe lemon, green apple and grapefruit. Lively and versatile, this larger bottle of La Marca Sparkling wine is ideal for your next dinner party. It's perfect on its own, in a bubbly cocktail or in a mimosa. This Italian wine can stand alone as an aperitif and also has the body and acidity to pair well with a range of foods. The attractive 1.5 liter bottle looks impressive on your party bar and makes a welcome sparkling wine gift. Make every day sparkle with La Marca Prosecco sparkling wine.

Check out our 2020 National Prosecco Week Virtual Tasting: https://youtu.be/RW39JUQZCYs

name: La Posta Pizzella Malbec
description:
La Posta’s wines are each named after the grower of the vineyard the wine comes from. 'Enjoy the simpler times' with this rich Malbec that is full of life. 

A full-bodied and well structured wine with aromas of black cherries, dark fruits, dark chocolate and baker's spice. A versatile pairing wine that goes great with meat & BBQ. Try with grilled polenta with wild mushroom ragout, grilled quail with quinoa, currants & pine nuts or wild boar with sage & dried cherry risotto.

name: La Rioja Alta Vina Arana Rioja Gran Reserva
description: na

name: La Scolca Gavi Bianco Secco White Label
description: na

name: La Vieille Ferme Brut Rose Reserve
description: La Vieille Ferme Réserve Rosé Brut is designed to share your celebration in elegance and simplicity. Whether served as an aperitif with friends or at a lavish banquet, this wine will help you enjoy the memorable moment, bringing conviviality and liberty. Delicate peach core with seductive raspberry hints and fine exquisite bubbles. A first nose of fresh red fruit (raspberry, wild strawberry), giving way to a perfect balance between freshness, acidity and roundness. Food Pairing: Pair with fresh sweet or savory appetizers. Versatile, it can accompany smoked fish appetizers just as well as fruit-based deserts, La Vieille Ferme Réserve Rosé Brut is to be served "without restrictions" and during any and all celebrations.

name: La Vieille Ferme Cotes Du Ventoux
description: Rhone, France- The Perrin family selects Grenache, Syrah, Carignan and Cinsault, vinifying in a manner reflecting their Châteauneuf tradition. This is a richly fruity and supple wine, ruby-purple colored, with aromas of cassis and herbs, flavors of plum and blackberry on the palate.

name: La Vieille Ferme Reserve Brut Sparkling
description: na

name: La Vieille Ferme Rose
description: This wonderfully fruity and intense, dry Rose comes from noble vines grown high on the slopes of Mont Ventoux. It has been meticulously selected and blended by the Perrin family, who also produces one of France's most acclaimed wines: Chateau de Baucastel. The distinctive, delightful character of La Vieille Ferme Rose comes from the judicious assemblage of wines from Grenache and Cinsault grapes. Serve well-chilled with light cuisine or on the terrace as a summer aperitif. Alc 13.5% by vol. Product of France.

name: La Vieille Ferme Rose Box
description: None

name: La Vieille Ferme Rouge 1.5l
description: Rhone, France- The Perrin family selects Grenache, Syrah, Carignan and Cinsault, vinifying in a manner reflecting their Châteauneuf tradition. This is a richly fruity and supple wine, ruby-purple colored, with aromas of cassis and herbs, flavors of plum and blackberry on the palate.

name: La Vieille Ferme White 3L Box
description: As proprietors of Chateau de Beaucastel in Chateauneuf-du-Pape, and producers of La Vieille Ferme from the Cotes du Ventoux and Luberon, the Perrin family has demonstrated exceptionally high standards for nearly a century. Jean-Pierre and Francois’s father, Jacques Perrin, was a gifted winemaker who brought world renown to the family domaine, introducing innovative techniques in the cellar, such as flash-heat exchange for maximum extract, integrated pest-control and organic farming practices in the vineyards. Now the next generation of winemakers has joined Jean-Pierre and Francois – Pierre, Marc, Thomas and Matthieu – to continue the proud family tradition.

name: Lab Red Blend
description:
VERIETAL- Castelao 35%, Tinta Roriz 25%, Syrah 25% and Touriga National 15%
VINTAGE-2015
TASTING NOTES-Juicy plums, dark berries, licorice and spice with fine well intetegrated, fine tannins on the finish. Bright ruby in color. Very aromatic.

name: Labruyere Champagne Prologue Grand Cru Brut
description: The wine offers intriguing complexity, with aromas of dried fruits, enhanced by subtle toasty aromas and roasted hazelnut. Rich and harmonious on the palate. Beautiful structure of Pinot Noir is exquisitely intertwined with tension and energy of Chardonnay. Delicate and persistent on the finish.

name: Lacourte Godbillon Champagne Millesime 1er Cru
varietal: Sparkling, Champagne, Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Vintage, Millisime, 90 Point Wine, Systainable, France
description: Our vision for the wine is simple, almost simplistic: It must be an expression of its terroir. The oak used for our barrels is sourced from the Écueil forest or from Champagne-Ardenne. Each plot is pressed and vinified separately and the juice is moved by gravity as far as possible and not pumped, to conserve the musts’ intrinsic qualities. Fermentations are temperature controlled and monitored daily. The wines stay in tank or barrel in contact with their lees deposits, without racking, for the whole autumn period, so they develop their full complexity and unique personality. For the wines made in oak barrels, no stirring or filtering is carried out. The chilling process then takes place... outside in the winter cold! The bottles are aged in our cellars for between 30 months and 7 years. This is followed by an average resting time of 3 to 6 months after the yeast deposits have been removed (disgorgement). The optimum "dosage" for each wine in each year is decided by several trial tastings. Our objective is to find the best possible balance as each wine is a living being with its own character.

name: Lafage Bastide Miraflors Vielles Vignes

name: Lafage Novellum Chardonnay
description: Novellum is a custom cuvée of Chardonnay grown and made by Jean Marc and Eliane Lafage for Eric Solomon.

name: Lafarge Volnay Premier Cru Les Caillerets
description: When you open a bottle of Domaine Michel Lafarge, there’s an unmistakable feeling that you’re connecting with something deeper. Sadly, we lost Michel in early 2020 but his son, Frédéric, will continue to guide the domaine in the example set by his father.

name: Lamberti Prosecco Extra Dry Veneto
description: Floral aromas with peach and tropical fruit notes mark this delicious Prosecco. Lively and effervescent, the palate is clean and crisp with balanced acidity and a lingering finish.

name: Lamole Di Lamole Chianti Classico
description: Lamole di Lamole draws its name and its character from the enchanting valley first discovered and cultivated by the Romans, and where these fine Chianti Classico wines were born. Selected from exclusive lines of grapes, shaped by the valley’s unique microclimate, and crafted in the cellars of an ancient castle, the wines of Lamole di Lamole offer exceptional flavors that complement the finest traditional meals and which only get better with age.

name: Landmark Vineyard Overlook Chardonnay
description: The 2018 Landmark Vineyards Overlook Chardonnay drinks supremely well. This wine delivers the components imbibers want. Enjoy its combination of ripe fruit, savory spices, and oak with grilled pork chops.

name: Lang & Reed Wine Co. North Coast Cabernet Franc
description: YUM! Delicious! Ripe, lush raspberries, medium bodied, elegant subtle peppery finish. Perfection.

name: Las Rocas Garnacha
description: The intense, ruby red color of Las Rocas Spanish Garnacha Red Wine is complemented by vibrant aromas and rich, layered notes of dark cherry, blackberries and raspberries. The luscious fruit characteristics meld with nuances of oak and round tannins, creating a balanced, full bodied red wine delivering a lasting finish. Enjoy this Spanish red wine on its own or with any food. Las Rocas de San Alejandro delights wine lovers with affordable and high-quality Spanish wines.

name: Laurent Miquel Pere Et Fils Cinsault Syrah Rose
description: Characterized by a beautiful pale pink hue, this wine epitomizes the best of southern French rosés with fruit-forward flavors and perfect balance. The Cinsault adds a fresh, smooth texture to the blend and the Syrah reveals delicious red fruit flavors.

name: Laurent Perrier Brut
description:
This wine comes from the purest grape juice and it alone allows Laurent‑Perrier to craft “La Cuvée”, a champagne of great finesse and a beautiful freshness obtained after a long ageing process in our cellars.

Laurent-Perrier’s style and personality are defined by its very high proportion of Chardonnay. Purity, freshness and elegance – essential characteristics, expressed in this champagne which embodies the spirit of the House.

name: Laurent Perrier Champagne Cuvee Rose
description:
Cuvée Rosé was created in 1968 from the boldness and unique savoir‑faire of Laurent‑Perrier. Perfected at each stage of its making, Cuvée Rosé is acknowledged for its consistency and its high quality.

It is characterized by its ripe red fruit aromas, a high intensity and great freshness.

name: Lauverjat Sancerre Perle Blanche
description: na

name: Laya Garnacha Monastrell
description: Garnacha Tintorera is known for its deep, inky color, and for coating theglass on the swirl. A rich and approachable wine with aromas of black fruit and berry, licorice, and espresso. A supple, balanced finish with hints of white pepper to complement the fruit.

name: Layer Cake Cabernet Sauvignon
description: na

name: Le Ragose Amarone Della Valpolicella Classico

name: Le Vieux Donjon Chateauneuf Du Pape
description: A traditional style for this Grenache-dominated Châteauneuf-du-Pape blend.  Bursting with freshness, this medium to full bodied wine has loads of brambly red and black fruit.  Structured and refined with crushed black pepper intertwined with dried roses and violets.

name: Leese Fitch Cabernet Sauvignon
description: The Leese-Fitch Cabernet Sauvignon begins with a pleasant aroma of black cherry, blackberry and violets along with a little baking spice and earth. Tasting the wine reveals it to be smooth and very easy to drink. Loaded with flavors of blackberry, plum, prunes and raisins it almost tastes a bit fortified (but not hot) and I like it. Light touches of oak, tobacco and caramel lead into the dry finish of this slightly sweet, medium-bodied wine. Lingering blackberry, prune and chocolate notes last for a good while in the mouth.

name: Leviathan Red Blend
varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Sirah
description:
The 2018 Leviathan boasts an intense mix of fresh boysenberry, black cherry, and plum aromatics. Its earthy elements of our rocky northern California hillsides include bay laurel, sage, cedar, and dry red earth, which speak to its origins. Supple and balanced tannins of this rich wine lead to a long savory finish.

Our 2018 proprietary blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah, Petite Sirah, and Cabernet Franc highlight some of my favorite growing regions in northern California: Coombsville, Carneros, Red Hills, Moon Mountain, Fountaingrove, and the Sierra Foothills.

name: Lewis Cellars Alec's Blend
description: na

name: Lewis Cellars Cabernet Napa Valley
description: na

name: Lewis Cellars Cabernet Sauvignon Reserve
